intro: Rhazya, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody shrub structure, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Rhazya species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh environments, making them resilient to drought and poor soil conditions. Some species are used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
